messages.title: OUR NHS: At risk
messages.content: The Conservative party representatives have been accused of accepting a donation from a private health firm and supporting NHS privatisation campaigners which puts the NHS at risk.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jane Brophy and the Liberal Democrats support diversity within the education system and selective education as seen in Altrincham and Sale West.
The Liberal Democrats will restore pensions, ensure fair pay for armed forces personnel, and have a costed plan to do it, marking a difference from other parties.

issues.education: Jane Brophy supports selective education at local schools such as Wellington High, Sale Grammar School, and Altrincham Grammar School.
issues.health: Highlighting the potential risks to the NHS by the Conservatives through their actions related to privatisation and donations.
issues.socialWelfare: The Liberal Democrats plan to restore pensions and provide fair pay for armed services, as opposed to the Conservative party's stance.

leaflet.personalStatement: Like every parent I want the best possible education for my family.

politicalExperience.role: Governor at Altrincham College of Arts

quotes.text: Tory Health spokesman accepted donation from private health firm.
We've lived through this mistake for 60 years now ...... The reality is [it the NHS] hasn't worked - it has made people ill....
David Cameron meets NHS privatisation campaigners
Key Tory MPs backed call to dismantle NHS

images.caption: Vince Cable discussing the banking crisis with Jane

leaflet.additionalNotes: What else aren't the Conservatives telling you?
